Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal document dated Packhons, year 12 of Ptolemy IV Philopator. On recto, 6 ll. of demotic and 2 ll. of Greek; on verso, names of 6 witnesses. Cession of house in Armant by Melas son of Apollonios and his wife Senobastis to Senminis daughter of Psenmonthes.Scribe Herieus son of Harsiesis.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.87-9, pl.72, 74, 84)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2728) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2728)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: displaced fragments Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete -large section missing at lower right)
